entry.pr: ˈprä-grəs, -ˌgres, US also & British usually ˈprō-ˌgres
entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French progrés, from Latin progressus advance, from progredi to go forth, from pro- forward + gradi to go pro-, grade

def.dt: :a royal journey marked by pomp and pageant
:a tour or circuit made by an official (as a judge)
:an expedition, journey, or march through a region
:a forward or onward movement (as to an objective or to a goal) :advance
:to develop to a higher, better, or more advanced stage
